title: gsus.dev
author: gsus.dev
content: HelloI want to delete my account and all the messages and threads I created.Thanks

comments.author: EL MOHA
comments.body: You can delete your account, I think only the admin has that power. But you can simply just reset the password and put in some characters you can remember and then that’s it. Before then you can just delete your quotes but as for the threads you can’t delete them yourself except the moderators do that for you. I don’t know the reason why you want to delete your account but once you reset the password to what you can remember no body will even know this account exists in the forum if all your posts or threads die down

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: gsus.dev on November 24, 2023, 10:57:12 AMHelloI want to delete my account and all the messages and threads I created.ThanksSimply click the “report to moderator” button to all the thread that you created since they are the only one who can delete the thread. Just state the reason on the description and admin will surely take care of it.Account can’t be deleted here. But you can follow suggestion above to completely forget about your account.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor

And in a little time, you hit 4 merits which were sent from a respected member LoyceV.This shows that you are making sense in your posting. It would be nice if you spit the reason out or better still take a break to rethink this. You might thank me later.

comments.author: johnsaributua
comments.body: You have only been using the bitcointalk forum for one day, but your understanding and experience is quite a lot wallau comes from your own self-taught, if you feel you have missed in the post, you can correct the source, your way of writing is neat in responding or thinking with the topic being discussed, it is difficult for a newbie to get a merit especially with a useful post, your post breaks the tradition for newbie,  if you can survive in my opinion your account will be quickly established, with your insight.If your determination is already bu;lat to leave the forum, the way for private messages and topics that you write, you can delete one by one while for replies to other people's threads, you can click Report to moderator at the bottom right of your post and change the password randomly without remembering it, in my opinion it is not the active status of the account but no one will glance if your account has no posts. Hopefully your decision can be reconsidered, and maybe it's the best in your opinion.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: You can delete your posts manually; Bitcointalk doesn't have a "delete user" feature.

Edit each topic replace text with some garbage text or "x" something this and later moderators will delete the topic as well. if you want to use a script then use this created by someone:Quote from: SwayStar123 on October 07, 2023, 01:22:18 PMSince you cant delete your account here, and deleting posts manually one by one is a pain, i made a python script to automatically delete all posts that can be deleted, and to edit those which can only be edited (changes subject and message to "x")Edit:Quote from: gsus.dev on November 24, 2023, 11:47:05 AMBased on your responses I will decide to stay in the forum and continue collaborating with others and learning new things.wow glad to hear that you're considering staying on the forum and engaging with the community. Stay anonymous and stay vigilant never trust unknown emails or messages too.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.created_time: November 24, 2023, 03:50:41 PMLast edit: November 24, 2023, 05:16:39 PM by Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: gsus.dev on November 24, 2023, 11:47:05 AMHello,Thank you for your kind words and excuse my radical attitude.The reason why is that I asked how could I pay with my Bitcoin and which taxation would be applied.I got a response from an user as if I was trying not to pay taxes and elude my tax responsibilities.I’m worried someone can legally attack me and sue me because of financial misdemeanor.Based on your responses I will decide to stay in the forum and continue collaborating with others and learning new things.ThanksWell, it's my turn to respond because I am the user, and what I have to say is that he hasn't understood anything. I have explained tax avoidance, which is legal, but I think it is better if I quote what I said, translating it.Quote from: gsus.dev on November 23, 2023, 06:33:32 PMI am trying to find smart ways to use my funds.<...>I hope my educational interest in learning more about the fiscal and practical usability aspect in the real world of cryptocurrencies is noted.My reply:Quote from: Don Pedro Dinero on November 24, 2023, 04:50:02 AMWell, first of all it will depend, as it is not the same if you have 2,000 euros as 200,000 euros. In the second case I would consult Crypto Spain or someone similar. <...>As a summary, and as I have just commented in another thread, it seems that what you are looking for is tax avoidance, which consists of minimising the payment of taxes within the law. None of the 5 points minimise it, so, as I said at the beginning, depending on the money you have, consider consulting an expert in tax avoidance, as no one on the local forum is one.What he needs to do, as DdmrDdmr has recommended, is not to take things so personally, and I would add that even less so when he has not understood them. PS: OP has finally understood and apologized, so I'm reporting the thread to be locked.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: gsus.dev on November 24, 2023, 11:47:05 AMI’m worried someone can legally attack me and sue me because of financial misdemeanor. Even if your account was deleted, users on Bitcointalk have post scrappers and everything you posted (just like anyone else) has been scrapped and there is a copy of it. Besides wiping everything you said from the forum, you would also have to ask the creators and owners of those scrappers to delete everything from their records. Glad you decided to stay.

comments.author: DYING_S0UL
comments.body: Quote from: gsus.dev on November 24, 2023, 11:47:05 AMI’m worried someone can legally attack me and sue me because of financial misdemeanor.You are afraid of that?  Think of me then. Where I live crypto and anything related to it is strictly banned. So what I am doing can be considered illegal. And the forum is all about crypto. Just using the forum might turn my life upside down. But despite every calamities, I am still using the forum.QuoteBased on your responses I will decide to stay in the forum and continue collaborating with others and learning new things.You did the right thing to give it a chance. If you try hard enough you might find people similar to your case where they were all afraid in the past but now are using the forum without any problem. You might even find people nearby where you reside. So, you are not alone here. Scroll through the threads and navigate a little, and you'll find something that might interest you.Lastly congratulations, gsus.dev. I wish you best of luck for this new journey.
